Black defends his pawn. I see this option almost every time I play Queen's gambit.
So, I continued with Nc3, intending Bf4 and Nb5 later on, which I have never tried to play.
Black continues by developing his Bishop on e7.
I played as I wanted, but later on someting changed...
Black puts his knight on f6, which allowed me to play 5. Nb5, but...
I thought it would be better if first I give some places to my bishop to go and also to defend my c4 pawn.
With this Black avoided my next intended, Nb5 move.
I had nothing to do, but to develop my other minor pieces and to keep on planning.
I think this was the first wrong move from Black. Guess if what was my next move!

But two things were sure. 1:He has no Nc6 move 2: ...
